name: Michael Schumacher

roles_affiliations: UNESCO champion for sport and ability
Formula One Driver for Jordan Grand Prix, Benetton Formula, Scuderia Ferrari, and Mercedes F1 Team
structured_info.background: Michael Schumacher is a German retired racing driver born January 3, 1969, widely considered one of the greatest Formula One drivers of all time. He is a seven-time Formula One World Champion, holding numerous records including wins, pole positions, and podium finishes. He experienced a serious head injury in 2013.

summary: Michael Schumacher is a highly decorated German racing driver and Formula One legend, known for winning seven World Championships and setting numerous records. Beyond racing, he is involved in humanitarian work as a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador and UNESCO champion.

name: Lewis Hamilton

structured_info.background: Lewis Hamilton is a highly accomplished Formula One driver, holding the record for most World Drivers' Championships, tied with Michael Schumacher at seven championships.

summary: Lewis Hamilton is a celebrated Formula One driver renowned for his seven World Drivers' Championships, a record shared with Michael Schumacher.

name: Kimi Räikkönen

structured_info.background: Kimi Räikkönen is a Formula One driver who notably competed with Michael Schumacher and challenged for the Formula One World Championship, narrowly missing out on the 2005 title.

summary: Kimi Räikkönen is a Formula One driver known for his competitiveness, particularly his rivalry with Michael Schumacher and a close challenge for the 2005 World Championship while driving for McLaren-Mercedes.

name: Juan Pablo Montoya

structured_info.background: Juan Pablo Montoya is a Formula One driver known for his rivalry with Michael Schumacher. He was a championship contender and achieved a second-place finish at the 2003 US Grand Prix.

summary: Juan Pablo Montoya is a Formula One driver who competed for Williams and challenged for the World Drivers’ Championship, notably finishing second at the 2003 US Grand Prix.

name: Corinna Schumacher

structured_info.background: Corinna Schumacher is publicly known primarily through her relationship with Michael Schumacher. No specific professional role or affiliation beyond this is detailed in the provided information.

summary: Corinna Schumacher is known as the spouse of Michael Schumacher. Information regarding her own independent career or activities is not currently available.
